result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared A Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Operation/Vehicle, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.10(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
FORTHWITH.
Credit for 4 days.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
APPLY $5,000.00 BAIL TO Restitution, if no objection received within 14 days. (to be paid to Deborah Ptak) Balance to be paid from Prison wages and as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Court costs and DNA to be paid from Prison wages and as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defense has 14 to object to the restitution amount and request a hearing. If no timely objection is received, Court then orders restitution in the amount listed. CASH BAIL to be held by the Court until final determination of restitution.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jared A Weber in court with attorneys Mark Phillip Maciolek and Hal Harlowe.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deborah Ptak, victim's mother, makes statement.  State makes sentencing recommendation.  Defense makes sentencing recommendation.  Defendant makes statement.  

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

8 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 4 days).  Defendant remanded to custody forthwith. 
  -  4 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  4 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;

RESTITUTION:  $6,236.30 to Deborah Ptak  (apply cash bail; balance to be paid from prison wages and/or to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
**Defense has 14 days to object to the restitution amount and request a restitution hearing.  If no timely objection is received, Court then orders restitution in the amount listed.  
Cash bail to be held by the Court until final determination of restitution.**

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid from prison wages and/or to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid from prison wages and/or to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant Jared A Weber in court with attorney Hal Harlowe.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an Amended Information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 of the amended Information.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court conducts plea colloquy with defendant.  State takes no position on bail.  State to submit video for Court's review prior to sentencing with recommendation on start/stop times.  Defense will also submit recommendation as to viewing portions.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 13, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jared A Weber in court with attorney Mark Phillip Maciolek.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for oral ruling on State's motions regarding testimony of Dr. Collins and Daniel Billington.  
Court rules that Dr. Collins will be excluded from testifying.  
Court rules that Daniel Billington will be excluded from testifying about the defendant's intent at the time of the crash.  
Court will allow limited reliance on John Buck's analysis of the structural integrity of the strut.
Court sets #1 trial date.  Parties to notify Court by June 30, 2017 if their witnesses are not available.  
Defense to notify Court by June 30, 2017 if they intend on calling Mr. Buck as a witness.  If defense intends to testify, then the Court will set a Daubert hearing.  Defense to file Mr. Buck's expert report prior to Daubert hearing.  
Previously issued trial scheduling order applies to new dates.  
  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 3, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 27, 2017 at 10:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for July 3, 2017.

Motion to Exclude the Testimony of Dr. Deborah Collins
Exhibits 1, 2, 4, 5 and 6
and Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits.

Defendant Jared A Weber in court with attorneys Hal Harlowe and Mark Phillip Maciolek.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for Daubert hearing to determine the admissibility of any expert witnesses that the defense intends to introduce at trial.  Parties present statements.  Defense files Dr. Collins report.  Court to review report.  

Daniel Billington sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the defendant.  Defense presents Exhibit 1, marked and received.  Cross-examination by State.  State presents Exhibits 4 and 5, marked.  Re-direct by defense.  State requests to brief this issue further.  Defense does not object and makes statement.  Court to issue decision as to Mr. Billington and Dr. Collins.

Court to hold separate hearing as to John Buck's testimony.  Court adjourns trial and discusses further scheduling with parties.  State makes statement.  

Court orders that the State's brief as to Dr. Collins is due by February 24, 2017.  The defense's responsive brief is due March 10, 2017.  

State orders today's hearing transcript.  Court reporter to notify the Court when the transcript is filed and Court will issue an order requiring briefing schedule as to Mr. Billington (state's brief due within 2 weeks of the transcript being filed and the defense's responsive brief due two weeks after State's brief).  Clerk to contact the parties to schedule an oral decision.  Parties to submit any video along with their briefs.  

Exhibits 2 and 6, marked and received.  Exhibits 4 and 5, received.  Exhibit 3 withdrawn.

Granting in part, and denying in part, defendant's Motion to Admit Character Evidence Pursuant to Wis. Stat. 904.04(1)(a), and denying defendant's Motion in Limine to Exclude Lay Opinion and Motion in Limine to Exclude or Limit Prejudicial Evidence.

Defendant Jared A Weber in court with attorneys Mark Phillip Maciolek and Hal Harlowe.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for defendant's motions.  Defense presents arguments for Motion to Admit Character Evidence.  State presents arguments.  Court will grant in part with respect to character evidence relating to the defendant's driving habits, particularly safe or careful driving habits, and deny in part to admit character evidence relative to characteristics for peacefulness, gentleness and non-violence.
 
Defense presents arguments for their Motion in Limine to Exclude Lay Opinion.  State presents arguments.  Court denies defendant's motion to exclude lay opinion.  

Defense presents arguments for their Motion in Limine to Exclude or Limit Prejudicial Evidence.  State presents arguments.  Court denies defendant's motion to exclude or limit prejudicial evidence.

State requests adjournment of the trial due to witness unavailability.   Defense opposes.  Court denies State's request.  Trial date remains as set.  Next motion date remains as set.
